member.name: T:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.CameraMovement.CameraMovement
member.summary:
- Feature: Visual Tweaks
Various effects within the game can be harmful, and even potentially fatal to some players.
This mod helps to alleviate some of these issues by allowing the player to disable various rendered effects and sound effects.

member.name: T:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.ColourCorrection.ColourCorrection
member.summary:
- Feature: Colour Correction
Helps people with poor vision, light sensitivity, or colour-blindness.Playing around with the colour settings can give everything a warm, or cool hue.
- Choose from different presets to simulate different colour vision deficiencies. - Adjust the colour balance, and saturation of the game scene.

member.name: M:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.ColourCorrection.ColourCorrection.ConfigureClientModServices(ApacheTech.Common.DependencyInjection.Abstractions.IServiceCollection)

member.name: T:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.ColourCorrection.ColourCorrectionSettings
member.summary: User definable settings for the Colour Correction feature. Overrides the game's default colour and saturation balance.

member.name: P:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.ColourCorrection.ColourCorrectionSettings.Enabled
member.summary: Represents a value indicating whether the colour correction shader is enabled, or not.
member.value: true if enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.ColourCorrection.ColourCorrectionSettings.Preset
member.summary: Represents a preset of colour balance and saturation settings, used to simulate various colour vision deficiencies.
member.value: The currently active preset of .

member.name: P:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.ColourCorrection.ColourCorrectionSettings.Red
member.summary: Represents how much Red to apply to the scene.
member.value: A value that represents the balance of the Red colour channel within the game scene.

member.name: P:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.ColourCorrection.ColourCorrectionSettings.Green
member.summary: Represents how much Green to apply to the scene.
member.value: A value that represents the balance of the Green colour channel within the game scene.

member.name: P:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.ColourCorrection.ColourCorrectionSettings.Blue
member.summary: Represents how much Blue to apply to the scene.
member.value: A value that represents the balance of the Blue colour channel within the game scene.

member.name: P:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.ColourCorrection.ColourCorrectionSettings.Saturation
member.summary: Represents the colour saturation of the scene. Lower values fade colours out, higher values make colours more vibrant.
member.value: A value that represents the saturation of the colours within the game scene.

member.name: T:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.ColourCorrection.Dialogue.ColourCorrectionDialogue
member.summary: User interface for the colour correction settings. Gives presets for colour blindness simulation, and allows custom configuration of colour and saturation balance.

member.summary: Standard human vision.

member.name: F:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.ColourCorrection.Enums.ColourVisionType.Protanopia
member.summary: No perception of Red colours.

member.name: F:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.ColourCorrection.Enums.ColourVisionType.Protanomaly
member.summary: Reduced perception of Red colours.

member.name: F:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.ColourCorrection.Enums.ColourVisionType.Deuteranopia
member.summary: No perception of Green colours.

member.name: F:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.ColourCorrection.Enums.ColourVisionType.Deuteranomaly
member.summary: Reduced perception of Green colours.

member.name: F:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.ColourCorrection.Enums.ColourVisionType.Tritanopia
member.summary: No perception of Blue colours.

member.name: F:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.ColourCorrection.Enums.ColourVisionType.Tritanomaly
member.summary: Reduced perception of Blue colours.

member.name: F:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.ColourCorrection.Enums.ColourVisionType.Achromatopsia
member.summary: No perception of any colours.

member.name: F:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.ColourCorrection.Enums.ColourVisionType.Achromatomaly
member.summary: Reduced perception of all colours.

member.summary:
- Feature: Sound Effects
The sounds within the game have not been normalised, so some sounds will be very loud, compared to others, even when played at the same game volume.
This feature allows the user to selectively choose the volume level for each in-game sound, individually, so that any white-noise can be filtered out.
Very useful for sufferers of Tinnitus, or white-noise affected epilepsy.
- Change the volume of every sound in the game, individually.
- Game sounds mute, when the game is paused.
- Game sounds mute, when the game window loses focus.

member.name: T:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Features.TextAlteration.TextAlteration
member.summary:
- Feature: Visual Tweaks
Various effects within the game can be harmful, and even potentially fatal to some players.
This mod helps to alleviate some of these issues by allowing the player to disable various rendered effects and sound effects.

member.name: T:ApacheTech.VintageMods.AccessibilityTweaks.Program
member.summary:
Entry-point for the mod. This class will configure and build the IOC Container, and Service list for the rest of the mod.
Registrations performed within this class should be global scope; by convention, features should aim to be as stand-alone as they can be.
member.remarks: Only one derived instance of this class should be added to any single mod within the VintageMods domain. This class will enable Dependency Injection, and add all of the domain services. Derived instances should only have minimal functionality, instantiating, and adding Application specific services to the IOC Container.

member.summary: Configures any services that need to be added to the IO Container, on the client side.
